5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	2.3 HTML Attributes	['HTML', 'Attributes']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	Attributes provide additional information about HTML elements. They are included in the start tag.	['Attributes', 'provide', 'additional', 'information', 'HTML', 'elements', 'included', 'start', 'tag']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•Common Attributes:	['Attributes']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	–class : Specifies one or more class names for CSS styling and JavaScript manipulation.	['Specifies', 'one', 'class', 'names', 'CSS', 'styling', 'JavaScript', 'manipulation']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	–id: Unique identifier for an element, used by CSS and JavaScript. Must be unique within a document.	['Unique', 'identifier', 'element', 'used', 'CSS', 'JavaScript', 'Must', 'unique', 'within', 'document']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	–style : Inline CSS styles applied directly to the element.	['Inline', 'CSS', 'styles', 'applied', 'directly', 'element']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	–title : Tooltip text that appears when the mouse hovers over the element.	['Tooltip', 'text', 'appears', 'mouse', 'hovers', 'element']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•Global Attributes (can be used on almost any HTML element):	['Attributes', 'used', 'almost', 'HTML', 'element']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	–accesskey : Specifies a keyboard shortcut to activate or focus an element.	['Specifies', 'keyboard', 'shortcut', 'activate', 'focus', 'element']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	–draggable : Specifies whether an element is draggable.	['Specifies', 'whether', 'element', 'draggable']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	–hidden : Hides an element.	['Hides', 'element']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	–lang : Language of the element’s content (e.g., lang="es" for Spanish).	['Language', 'element', 'content', 'es', 'Spanish']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	–dir: Text direction ( ltrfor left-to-right, rtlfor right-to-left).	['Text', 'direction', 'ltrfor', 'rtlfor']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	–spellcheck : Specifies whether the element should be spellchecked.	['Specifies', 'whether', 'element', 'spellchecked']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	–tabindex : Specifies the tab order of an element.	['Specifies', 'tab', 'order', 'element']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	–contenteditable : Specifies whether the content of an element is editable by the user.	['Specifies', 'whether', 'content', 'element', 'editable', 'user']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	–data-* : Used to store custom data private to the page or application.	['Used', 'store', 'custom', 'data', 'private', 'page', 'application']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•Event Attributes (JavaScript event handlers, e.g., onclick ,onload ,onsubmit ): Allow JavaScript code to be	['Attributes', 'JavaScript', 'event', 'handlers', 'onclick', 'onload', 'onsubmit', 'Allow', 'JavaScript', 'code']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	executed in response to events. Beyond the scope of basic HTML but important for interactive web pages.	['executed', 'response', 'events', 'Beyond', 'scope', 'basic', 'HTML', 'important', 'interactive', 'web', 'pages']

5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•<video> : Defines the video container.	['video', 'Defines', 'video', 'container']

5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	3.2.8 Combinators	['Combinators']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	Combinators define the relationship between selectors.	['Combinators', 'define', 'relationship', 'selectors']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•Descendant selector (space): Selects all descendants of an element.	['selector', 'space', 'Selects', 'descendants', 'element']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•Child selector ( >): Selects only direct children of an element.	['selector', 'Selects', 'direct', 'children', 'element']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•Adjacent sibling selector ( +): Selects the immediately following sibling element.	['sibling', 'selector', 'Selects', 'immediately', 'following', 'sibling', 'element']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•General sibling selector ( ~): Selects all sibling elements that follow after.	['sibling', 'selector', 'Selects', 'sibling', 'elements', 'follow']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	1/* Descendant selector */	['Descendant', 'selector']

5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	3.4 Common CSS Properties	['Common', 'CSS', 'Properties']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	CSS properties control various aspects of element styling.	['CSS', 'properties', 'control', 'various', 'aspects', 'element', 'styling']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	3.4.1 Text Properties	['Text', 'Properties']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•color : Text color (e.g., color: red; ).	['Text', 'color', 'color', 'red']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•font-family : Font (e.g., font-family: Arial, sans-serif; ).	['Font', 'Arial']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•font-size : Text size (e.g., font-size: 16px; ).	['Text', 'size']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•font-weight : Boldness (e.g., font-weight: bold; ).	['Boldness', 'bold']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•font-style : Italic or normal ( font-style: italic; ).	['Italic', 'normal', 'italic']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•text-align : Horizontal alignment ( text-align: center; ).	['Horizontal', 'alignment', 'center']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•text-decoration : Underline, overline, etc. ( text-decoration: underline; ).	['Underline', 'overline', 'etc', 'underline']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•line-height : Vertical space between lines (e.g., line-height: 1.5; ).	['Vertical', 'space', 'lines']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•letter-spacing : Space between characters (e.g., letter-spacing: 1px; ).	['Space', 'characters']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•word-spacing : Space between words (e.g., word-spacing: 5px; ).	['Space', 'words']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•text-transform : Uppercase, lowercase, capitalize ( text-transform: uppercase; ).	['Uppercase', 'lowercase', 'capitalize', 'uppercase']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•text-indent : Indentation of the first line of text ( text-indent: 20px; ).	['Indentation', 'first', 'line', 'text']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•white-space : Handles whitespace and line wrapping ( white-space: nowrap; ).	['Handles', 'whitespace', 'line', 'wrapping', 'nowrap']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•text-shadow : Adds shadow to text ( text-shadow: 2px 2px 3px 333; ).	['Adds', 'shadow', 'text']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	16	[]

5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•background-image : Background image (e.g., background-image: url("image.png"); ).	['Background', 'image', 'url']

5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•background-size : Image size ( background-size: cover; ,contain ,100px 50px , etc.).	['Image', 'size', 'cover', 'contain', 'etc']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•background-origin : Origin of the background image ( padding-box ,border-box ,content-box ).	['Origin', 'background', 'image']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•background-clip : Clipping of the background ( border-box ,padding-box ,content-box ,text ).	['Clipping', 'background', 'text']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•background-attachment : Background scrolling behavior ( scroll ,fixed ,local ).	['Background', 'scrolling', 'behavior', 'scroll', 'fixed', 'local']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•background : Shorthand property for setting multiple background properties in one declaration.	['Shorthand', 'property', 'setting', 'multiple', 'background', 'properties', 'one', 'declaration']

5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	3.4.4 Display Properties	['Display', 'Properties']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	Controls how elements are displayed and laid out.	['Controls', 'elements', 'displayed', 'laid']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•display: block; : Element takes up full width, starts a new line (like <div> ,<p>).	['block', 'Element', 'takes', 'full', 'width', 'starts', 'new', 'line', 'like', 'div', 'p']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•display: inline; : Element takes only necessary width, does not start a new line (like <span> ,<a>).	['inline', 'Element', 'takes', 'necessary', 'width', 'start', 'new', 'line', 'like', 'span']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•display: inline-block; : Inline flow, but can set width and height (like inline, but with block properties).	['Inline', 'flow', 'set', 'width', 'height', 'like', 'inline', 'block', 'properties']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•display: none; : Element is hidden and removed from page flow.	['none', 'Element', 'hidden', 'removed', 'page', 'flow']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•display: flex; : Enables Flexbox layout for flexible and responsive layouts.	['flex', 'Enables', 'Flexbox', 'layout', 'flexible', 'responsive', 'layouts']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•display: grid; : Enables Grid layout for two-dimensional layouts.	['grid', 'Enables', 'Grid', 'layout', 'layouts']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•display: list-item; : Makes an element behave like a list item.	['Makes', 'element', 'behave', 'like', 'list', 'item']

5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	3.4.5 Positioning Properties	['Positioning', 'Properties']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	Controls the position of elements within the document.	['Controls', 'position', 'elements', 'within', 'document']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•position: static; : Default positioning, follows normal document flow.	['static', 'Default', 'positioning', 'follows', 'normal', 'document', 'flow']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•position: relative; : Position relative to its normal position. Use top,right ,bottom ,left to offset.	['relative', 'Position', 'relative', 'normal', 'position', 'Use', 'top', 'right', 'bottom', 'left', 'offset']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•position: absolute; : Removed from document flow, positioned relative to nearest positioned ancestor (or	['absolute', 'Removed', 'document', 'flow', 'positioned', 'relative', 'nearest', 'positioned', 'ancestor']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	<html> ).	['html']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•position: fixed; : Removed from document flow, positioned relative to viewport, stays fixed during scrolling.	['fixed', 'Removed', 'document', 'flow', 'positioned', 'relative', 'viewport', 'stays', 'fixed', 'scrolling']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•position: sticky; : Relative until a threshold is met, then becomes fixed (sticks to the viewport during scroll).	['sticky', 'Relative', 'threshold', 'met', 'becomes', 'fixed', 'sticks', 'viewport', 'scroll']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•top,right ,bottom ,left : Offsets for positioned elements. Can use pixel values, percentages, or other CSS units.	['right', 'bottom', 'left', 'Offsets', 'positioned', 'elements', 'use', 'pixel', 'values', 'percentages', 'CSS', 'units']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•z-index : Stack order of elements (higher value is in front). Only works on positioned elements (relative, absolute,	['Stack', 'order', 'elements', 'higher', 'value', 'front', 'works', 'positioned', 'elements', 'relative', 'absolute']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	fixed, sticky).	['fixed', 'sticky']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•float : Positions an element to the left or right and allows text and inline elements to wrap around it ( float:	['Positions', 'element', 'left', 'right', 'allows', 'text', 'inline', 'elements', 'wrap', 'around', 'float']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	left; ,float: right; ,float: none; ). Often used for layout, but Flexbox and Grid are generally preferred for	['left', 'float', 'right', 'float', 'none', 'Often', 'used', 'layout', 'Flexbox', 'Grid', 'generally', 'preferred']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	modern layouts.	['modern', 'layouts']

5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	clear: left; ,clear: right; ,clear: none; ). Used to control flow around floated elements.	['clear', 'left', 'clear', 'right', 'clear', 'none', 'Used', 'control', 'flow', 'around', 'floated', 'elements']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	3.5 CSS Units	['CSS', 'Units']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	Units in CSS define sizes and lengths.	['Units', 'CSS', 'define', 'sizes', 'lengths']
5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	3.5.1 Absolute Units	['Absolute', 'Units']

5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•px(pixels): Basic unit, device-dependent. Generally recommended for screen sizes.	['pixels', 'Basic', 'unit', 'Generally', 'recommended', 'screen', 'sizes']

5 IDX G9 CS S.pdf	2025-04-04 19:31:36	•%: Percentage, relative to parent element or viewport. Very versatile for responsive design.	['Percentage', 'relative', 'parent', 'element', 'viewport', 'versatile', 'responsive', 'design']

3 IDX G9 CS H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	    print(i)	['print']
3 IDX G9 CS H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	In this example, the value of i goes from 0 to 4, yet when the value was 3, the for loop was exited due to the break statement, therefore the output of the code would be:	['example', 'value', 'goes', 'yet', 'value', 'loop', 'exited', 'due', 'break', 'statement', 'therefore', 'output', 'code', 'would']

3 IDX G9 CS H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	    print(i)	['print']
3 IDX G9 CS H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	In this example, when i = 3, the continue statement merely exited the current loop iteration, or in other words, moved on to i = 4 without executing the rest of the loop (print statement), and therefore the output would be:	['example', 'continue', 'statement', 'merely', 'exited', 'current', 'loop', 'iteration', 'words', 'moved', 'without', 'executing', 'rest', 'loop', 'print', 'statement', 'therefore', 'output', 'would']

3 IDX G9 CS H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	This code reads a .txt file, counts the occurrences of each word, and prints the results.	['code', 'reads', 'file', 'counts', 'occurrences', 'word', 'prints', 'results']
3 IDX G9 CS H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	def count_words_in_file(filename):	['def', 'filename']
3 IDX G9 CS H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	    word_count = {} # Create an empty dictionary to store word counts	['Create', 'empty', 'dictionary', 'store', 'word', 'counts']
3 IDX G9 CS H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	    with open(filename, 'r') as file: # Open the file for reading	['open', 'filename', 'r', 'file', 'Open', 'file', 'reading']
3 IDX G9 CS H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	        content = file.read() # Read the entire file content	['content', 'Read', 'entire', 'file', 'content']
3 IDX G9 CS H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	        words = content.split() # Split the content into words based on spaces	['words', 'Split', 'content', 'words', 'based', 'spaces']
3 IDX G9 CS H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	        # Count the occurrences of each word	['Count', 'occurrences', 'word']
3 IDX G9 CS H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	        for word in words:	['word', 'words']
3 IDX G9 CS H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	            word = word.lower() # Convert to lowercase to ensure case insensitivity	['word', 'Convert', 'lowercase', 'ensure', 'case', 'insensitivity']
3 IDX G9 CS H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	            if word in word_count:	['word']
3 IDX G9 CS H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	                word_count[word] += 1	['word']
3 IDX G9 CS H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	            else:	['else']

3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	Plate Tectonics	['Plate', 'Tectonics']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- A scientific theory describing the motion of Earth's plates.	['scientific', 'theory', 'describing', 'motion', 'Earth', 'plates']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- Tectonic processes began 3.3–3.5 billion years ago	['Tectonic', 'processes', 'began', 'billion', 'years', 'ago']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	Supercontinents	['Supercontinents']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- Earth's continents have repeatedly collided and broken apart over its history.	['Earth', 'continents', 'repeatedly', 'collided', 'broken', 'apart', 'history']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- Supercontinents  influence:	['Supercontinents', 'influence']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	  - Ocean currents.	['Ocean', 'currents']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	  - Climate and weather patterns.	['Climate', 'weather', 'patterns']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	  - Biodiversity.	['Biodiversity']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	Tectonic Plates	['Tectonic', 'Plates']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- Major tectonic plates include:	['Major', 'tectonic', 'plates', 'include']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	  - Eurasian, North American, South American, African, Antarctic, Indo-Australian, Pacific.	['Eurasian', 'North', 'American', 'South', 'American', 'African', 'Antarctic', 'Pacific']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- Plates move at about 2–10 cm per year	['Plates', 'move', 'cm', 'per', 'year']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	Types of Plate Boundaries	['Types', 'Plate', 'Boundaries']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	1. Divergent Boundaries:	['Divergent', 'Boundaries']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	   - Plates move apart, creating new crust.	['Plates', 'move', 'apart', 'creating', 'new', 'crust']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	   - Example: Mid-Atlantic Ridge	['Example', 'Ridge']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	   - On land: Great Rift Valley in Africa	['land', 'Great', 'Rift', 'Valley', 'Africa']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	   - Driven by rising magma beneath the crust.	['Driven', 'rising', 'magma', 'beneath', 'crust']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	2. Convergent Boundaries:	['Convergent', 'Boundaries']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	   - Plates collide, leading to crust destruction.	['Plates', 'collide', 'leading', 'crust', 'destruction']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	   - Types:	['Types']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	     - Continent-Continent: Forms mountains 	['Forms', 'mountains']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	     - Continent-Ocean: Denser oceanic plate subducts beneath the continental plate, forming volcanic arcs.	['Denser', 'oceanic', 'plate', 'subducts', 'beneath', 'continental', 'plate', 'forming', 'volcanic', 'arcs']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	     - Ocean-Ocean: One oceanic plate subducts, creating volcanic island arcs 	['One', 'oceanic', 'plate', 'subducts', 'creating', 'volcanic', 'island', 'arcs']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	     	[]
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	3. Transform Boundaries:	['Transform', 'Boundaries']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	   - Plates slide past each other horizontally.	['Plates', 'slide', 'past', 'horizontally']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	Folding and Faulting	['Folding', 'Faulting']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- Folding:	['Folding']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	  - Rocks bend due to compressional forces, creating folds and, eventually, metamorphic rocks under pressure.	['Rocks', 'bend', 'due', 'compressional', 'forces', 'creating', 'folds', 'eventually', 'metamorphic', 'rocks', 'pressure']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- Faulting:	['Faulting']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	  - Rocks break dueto tension or compression, forming faults where blocks of crust move relative to each other.	['Rocks', 'break', 'dueto', 'tension', 'compression', 'forming', 'faults', 'blocks', 'crust', 'move', 'relative']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	Hot Spots	['Hot', 'Spots']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- Areas where magma rises through weakened portions of crust, forming volcanic islands.	['Areas', 'magma', 'rises', 'weakened', 'portions', 'crust', 'forming', 'volcanic', 'islands']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	Natural Disasters	['Natural', 'Disasters']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	Natural Disasters	['Natural', 'Disasters']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- Defined as the impact of natural hazards that cause significant human, financial, or environmental loss.	['Defined', 'impact', 'natural', 'hazards', 'cause', 'significant', 'human', 'financial', 'environmental', 'loss']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	Volcanoes:	['Volcanoes']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- A volcano is a mountain or hill with a vent that releases lava, steam, and ash.	['volcano', 'mountain', 'hill', 'vent', 'releases', 'lava', 'steam', 'ash']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	How Volcanoes Form	['Volcanoes', 'Form']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- Occur at divergent, convergent boundaries, and hot spots.	['Occur', 'divergent', 'convergent', 'boundaries', 'hot', 'spots']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- Divergent Volcanoes:	['Divergent', 'Volcanoes']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	  - Found at plate boundaries where plates pull apart	['Found', 'plate', 'boundaries', 'plates', 'pull', 'apart']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- Convergent Volcanoes:	['Convergent', 'Volcanoes']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	  - Occur where plates collide, causing subduction:	['Occur', 'plates', 'collide', 'causing', 'subduction']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	    - Ocean-Ocean: Form volcanic island arcs	['Form', 'volcanic', 'island', 'arcs']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	    - Ocean-Continent: Form mountains	['Form', 'mountains']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	    - Continent-Continent: Build tall mountain ranges	['Build', 'tall', 'mountain', 'ranges']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- Hot Spot Volcanoes:	['Hot', 'Spot', 'Volcanoes']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	  - Located within tectonic plates	['Located', 'within', 'tectonic', 'plates']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	  - Caused by rising magma from the mantle.	['Caused', 'rising', 'magma', 'mantle']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	Volcano Types	['Volcano', 'Types']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	1. Cinder Cone Volcanoes:	['Cinder', 'Cone', 'Volcanoes']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	   - Small, steep sided cones made of pyroclastic.	['Small', 'steep', 'sided', 'cones', 'made', 'pyroclastic']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	   - near fault lines and subduction zones.	['near', 'fault', 'lines', 'subduction', 'zones']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	2. Shield :	['Shield']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	   - Large, gently sloping domes formed by mafic lava.	['Large', 'gently', 'sloping', 'domes', 'formed', 'mafic', 'lava']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	3. Stratovolcanoes:	['Stratovolcanoes']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	   - Tall, cone shaped volcanoes with steep slopes.	['Tall', 'cone', 'shaped', 'volcanoes', 'steep', 'slopes']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	   - Layers of lava and ash; most dangerous type.	['Layers', 'lava', 'ash', 'dangerous', 'type']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	4. Caldera:	['Caldera']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	   - Large volcanic craters formed after massive eruptions.	['Large', 'volcanic', 'craters', 'formed', 'massive', 'eruptions']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	Lava Types	['Lava', 'Types']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- Mafic Lava:	['Mafic', 'Lava']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	  - Low viscosity	['Low', 'viscosity']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- Felsic Lava:	['Felsic', 'Lava']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	  - High viscosity	['High', 'viscosity']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	Volcanic Activity	['Volcanic', 'Activity']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	  - Active	['Active']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	  - Dormant	['Dormant']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	  - Extinct	['Extinct']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	- Volcanic Explosivity Index :	['Volcanic', 'Explosivity', 'Index']
3 IDX G9 GEO S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	  - Measure eruption intensity	['Measure', 'eruption', 'intensity']
5 IDX G9 GEO H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:36	NOTE: This is an official document by Indexademics.
