1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	2.5 Roots of Judaism 	['Roots', 'Judaism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Introduction to Monotheism	['Introduction', 'Monotheism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The concept of monotheism, or the worship of one God, is a fundamental aspect of Judaism. This belief is articulated in the Hebrew Bible, specifically in Exodus 20:2-3, where God speaks to Moses, emphasizing the importance of having no other gods. This belief distinguished the Israelites from other ancient cultures that practiced polytheism.	['concept', 'monotheism', 'worship', 'one', 'God', 'fundamental', 'aspect', 'Judaism', 'belief', 'articulated', 'Hebrew', 'Bible', 'specifically', 'Exodus', 'God', 'speaks', 'Moses', 'emphasizing', 'importance', 'gods', 'belief', 'distinguished', 'Israelites', 'ancient', 'cultures', 'practiced', 'polytheism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Roots of Judaism	['Roots', 'Judaism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Judaism originated around 4,000 years ago in the region that is now Israel, located at the western end of the Fertile Crescent. It has evolved into one of the world's major religions, deeply influencing the culture and identity of the Jewish people.	['Judaism', 'originated', 'around', 'years', 'ago', 'region', 'Israel', 'located', 'western', 'end', 'Fertile', 'Crescent', 'evolved', 'one', 'world', 'major', 'religions', 'deeply', 'influencing', 'culture', 'identity', 'Jewish', 'people']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Key Terms and Concepts	['Key', 'Terms', 'Concepts']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Monotheistic: Belief in one God.	['Monotheistic', 'Belief', 'one', 'God']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Torah: The most sacred text of Judaism, consisting of the first five books of the Hebrew Bible.	['Torah', 'sacred', 'text', 'Judaism', 'consisting', 'first', 'five', 'books', 'Hebrew', 'Bible']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Abraham: Considered the father of the Israelite people.	['Abraham', 'Considered', 'father', 'Israelite', 'people']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Covenant: A binding agreement between God and the Israelites.	['Covenant', 'binding', 'agreement', 'God', 'Israelites']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Moses: A key figure who renewed God's covenant with the Israelites.	['Moses', 'key', 'figure', 'renewed', 'God', 'covenant', 'Israelites']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	David and Solomon: Kings who played significant roles in establishing and expanding the kingdom of Israel.	['David', 'Solomon', 'Kings', 'played', 'significant', 'roles', 'establishing', 'expanding', 'kingdom', 'Israel']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Patriarchal: A society where men hold the majority of power and authority.	['Patriarchal', 'society', 'men', 'hold', 'majority', 'power', 'authority']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Sabbath: A holy day of rest and worship.	['Sabbath', 'holy', 'day', 'rest', 'worship']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Prophet: A spiritual leader who interprets God's will.	['Prophet', 'spiritual', 'leader', 'interprets', 'God']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Ethics: Moral principles that guide behavior.	['Ethics', 'Moral', 'principles', 'guide', 'behavior']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Beliefs of the Ancient Israelites	['Beliefs', 'Ancient', 'Israelites']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The ancient Israelites believed in an all-knowing, all-powerful God who was omnipresent. Their history and faith were intertwined, with events seen as reflections of God's plan. The Torah, their sacred text, records laws and events significant to their faith.	['ancient', 'Israelites', 'believed', 'God', 'omnipresent', 'history', 'faith', 'intertwined', 'events', 'seen', 'reflections', 'God', 'plan', 'Torah', 'sacred', 'text', 'records', 'laws', 'events', 'significant', 'faith']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Significance of the Dead Sea Scrolls	['Significance', 'Dead', 'Sea', 'Scrolls']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Discovered in 1947, the Dead Sea Scrolls are ancient texts that provide insight into early Jewish beliefs and practices. Written around 2,000 years ago, these scrolls were found in caves near Qumran and are crucial for understanding the development of Judaism.	['Discovered', 'Dead', 'Sea', 'Scrolls', 'ancient', 'texts', 'provide', 'insight', 'early', 'Jewish', 'beliefs', 'practices', 'Written', 'around', 'years', 'ago', 'scrolls', 'found', 'caves', 'near', 'Qumran', 'crucial', 'understanding', 'development', 'Judaism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Abraham and the Covenant	['Abraham', 'Covenant']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Abraham, who lived around 2000 B.C. in Mesopotamia, is recognized as the father of the Israelites. God made a agreement with him, promising that he would be the father of many nations and that his descendants would inherit the land of Canaan, which is viewed as the "promised land."	['Abraham', 'lived', 'around', 'Mesopotamia', 'recognized', 'father', 'Israelites', 'God', 'made', 'agreement', 'promising', 'would', 'father', 'many', 'nations', 'descendants', 'would', 'inherit', 'land', 'Canaan', 'viewed', 'promised', 'land']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Moses and the Exodus	['Moses', 'Exodus']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Moses renewed the covenant with the Israelites after they were enslaved in Egypt. He led them in the Exodus, a journey that took 40 years, ultimately bringing them to Canaan, although Moses died before entering the land.	['Moses', 'renewed', 'covenant', 'Israelites', 'enslaved', 'Egypt', 'led', 'Exodus', 'journey', 'took', 'years', 'ultimately', 'bringing', 'Canaan', 'although', 'Moses', 'died', 'entering', 'land']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Kingdom of Israel	['Kingdom', 'Israel']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	By 1000 B.C., the Israelites established the kingdom of Israel, uniting the twelve tribes under King David. His son Solomon expanded the kingdom and built the first temple in Jerusalem, which became a central place of worship.	['Israelites', 'established', 'kingdom', 'Israel', 'uniting', 'twelve', 'tribes', 'King', 'David', 'son', 'Solomon', 'expanded', 'kingdom', 'built', 'first', 'temple', 'Jerusalem', 'became', 'central', 'place', 'worship']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Division and Conquest of Israel	['Division', 'Conquest', 'Israel']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	After Solomon's death around 922 B.C., the kingdom split into Israel in the north and Judah in the south. Israel faced conquest by the Assyrians in 722 B.C., and Judah was captured by the Babylonians in 586 B.C., leading to the Babylonian Captivity.	['Solomon', 'death', 'around', 'kingdom', 'split', 'Israel', 'north', 'Judah', 'south', 'Israel', 'faced', 'conquest', 'Assyrians', 'Judah', 'captured', 'Babylonians', 'leading', 'Babylonian', 'Captivity']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Judaism and Law	['Judaism', 'Law']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Torah contains many laws, often referred to as the Books of the Law, which govern various aspects of life, including moral conduct and social justice. The Ten Commandments serve as a foundational ethical guide for Jews.	['Torah', 'contains', 'many', 'laws', 'often', 'referred', 'Books', 'Law', 'govern', 'various', 'aspects', 'life', 'including', 'moral', 'conduct', 'social', 'justice', 'Ten', 'Commandments', 'serve', 'foundational', 'ethical', 'guide', 'Jews']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Role of Prophets	['Role', 'Prophets']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Prophets like Isaiah and Jeremiah played a crucial role in interpreting God's will and urging devotion to the law. They emphasized the importance of social justice and moral behavior, advocating for the protection of the vulnerable.	['Prophets', 'like', 'Isaiah', 'Jeremiah', 'played', 'crucial', 'role', 'interpreting', 'God', 'urging', 'devotion', 'law', 'emphasized', 'importance', 'social', 'justice', 'moral', 'behavior', 'advocating', 'protection', 'vulnerable']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Diaspora	['Diaspora']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	During the Babylonian Captivity, many Jews dispersed across the world, a phenomenon known as the Diaspora. Despite being spread out, they maintained their identity and religious practices, which helped them endure persecution throughout history.	['Babylonian', 'Captivity', 'many', 'Jews', 'dispersed', 'across', 'world', 'phenomenon', 'known', 'Diaspora', 'Despite', 'spread', 'maintained', 'identity', 'religious', 'practices', 'helped', 'endure', 'persecution', 'throughout', 'history']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Judaism's Influence	['Judaism', 'Influence']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Judaism has significantly influenced other major religions, particularly Christianity and Islam. The shared heritage of Jews, Christians, and Muslims is often referred to as the Judeo-Christian tradition, highlighting their common ethical teachings and reverence for figures like Abraham and Moses.	['Judaism', 'significantly', 'influenced', 'major', 'religions', 'particularly', 'Christianity', 'Islam', 'shared', 'heritage', 'Jews', 'Christians', 'Muslims', 'often', 'referred', 'tradition', 'highlighting', 'common', 'ethical', 'teachings', 'reverence', 'figures', 'like', 'Abraham', 'Moses']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Conclusion	['Conclusion']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Judaism's unique contributions to religious thought and its emphasis on monotheism, law, and ethics have established it as a major world religion, shaping the beliefs and practices of millions across the globe. 1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	3.1 Early Civilizations of India and Pakistan	['Early', 'Civilizations', 'India', 'Pakistan']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Archaeologists in the early 1900s discovered remnants of a civilization in the Indus River valley, which had flourished 4,500 years earlier. This civilization was previously unknown and included cities like Harappa and Mohenjo-Daro.	['Archaeologists', 'early', 'discovered', 'remnants', 'civilization', 'Indus', 'River', 'valley', 'flourished', 'years', 'earlier', 'civilization', 'previously', 'unknown', 'included', 'cities', 'like', 'Harappa']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Geography of the Indian Subcontinent	['Geography', 'Indian', 'Subcontinent']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Indian subcontinent is a large landmass extending into the Indian Ocean, comprising India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, and Bhutan. The northern border is marked by the Himalayas and Hindu Kush mountains, which limited contact with other cultures.	['Indian', 'subcontinent', 'large', 'landmass', 'extending', 'Indian', 'Ocean', 'comprising', 'India', 'Pakistan', 'Bangladesh', 'Sri', 'Lanka', 'Nepal', 'Bhutan', 'northern', 'border', 'marked', 'Himalayas', 'Hindu', 'Kush', 'mountains', 'limited', 'contact', 'cultures']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The subcontinent is divided into three major zones:	['subcontinent', 'divided', 'three', 'major', 'zones']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The fertile Gangetic Plain in the north	['fertile', 'Gangetic', 'Plain', 'north']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The dry Deccan plateau	['dry', 'Deccan', 'plateau']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The coastal plains on either side of the Deccan	['coastal', 'plains', 'either', 'side', 'Deccan']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Monsoons and Climate	['Monsoons', 'Climate']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Monsoons are seasonal winds that significantly affect agriculture in the Indian subcontinent. The winter monsoons bring hot, dry air from the north, while the summer monsoons bring heavy rains essential for crops from the south. The timing and intensity of these rains can lead to famine or floods.	['Monsoons', 'seasonal', 'winds', 'significantly', 'affect', 'agriculture', 'Indian', 'subcontinent', 'winter', 'monsoons', 'bring', 'hot', 'dry', 'air', 'north', 'summer', 'monsoons', 'bring', 'heavy', 'rains', 'essential', 'crops', 'south', 'timing', 'intensity', 'rains', 'lead', 'famine', 'floods']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Indus Civilization Overview	['Indus', 'Civilization', 'Overview']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Indus civilization emerged around 2600 B.C. and lasted for about 700 years. Archaeological findings indicate that it was a well-organized society with advanced urban planning, including complex plumbing systems and standardized weights and measures.	['Indus', 'civilization', 'emerged', 'around', 'lasted', 'years', 'Archaeological', 'findings', 'indicate', 'society', 'advanced', 'urban', 'planning', 'including', 'complex', 'plumbing', 'systems', 'standardized', 'weights', 'measures']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Indus Civilization's Economy	['Indus', 'Civilization', 'Economy']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Most inhabitants were farmers growing crops like wheat and barley. They were also among the first to cultivate cotton. Trade was significant, with merchants exporting goods to Sumerian cities.	['inhabitants', 'farmers', 'growing', 'crops', 'like', 'wheat', 'barley', 'also', 'among', 'first', 'cultivate', 'cotton', 'Trade', 'significant', 'merchants', 'exporting', 'goods', 'Sumerian', 'cities']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Religious Beliefs of the Indus Civilization	['Religious', 'Beliefs', 'Indus', 'Civilization']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Indus Valley people were likely polytheistic, worshipping a mother goddess and various animal deities. These early practices may have influenced later Indian beliefs, particularly the reverence for cattle.	['Indus', 'Valley', 'people', 'likely', 'polytheistic', 'worshipping', 'mother', 'goddess', 'various', 'animal', 'deities', 'early', 'practices', 'may', 'influenced', 'later', 'Indian', 'beliefs', 'particularly', 'reverence', 'cattle']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Decline of the Indus Civilization	['Decline', 'Indus', 'Civilization']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	By 1900 B.C., the Indus civilization began to decline, with evidence of reduced quality in pottery and a halt in writing. The reasons for this decline are debated, with theories including environmental damage, flooding, and earthquakes.	['Indus', 'civilization', 'began', 'decline', 'evidence', 'reduced', 'quality', 'pottery', 'halt', 'writing', 'reasons', 'decline', 'debated', 'theories', 'including', 'environmental', 'damage', 'flooding', 'earthquakes']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Aryan Migration and Civilization	['Aryan', 'Migration', 'Civilization']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	By 1500 B.C., the Aryans, a nomadic people, migrated into India, bringing their language and culture. They transitioned from nomadic herding to settled farming, leading to the establishment of villages and the spread of iron tools.	['Aryans', 'nomadic', 'people', 'migrated', 'India', 'bringing', 'language', 'culture', 'transitioned', 'nomadic', 'herding', 'settled', 'farming', 'leading', 'establishment', 'villages', 'spread', 'iron', 'tools']

1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Vaisyas (farmers and merchants)	['Vaisyas', 'farmers', 'merchants']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Sudras (laborers)	['Sudras', 'laborers']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Aryan Religious Beliefs	['Aryan', 'Religious', 'Beliefs']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Aryans were polytheistic, worshipping gods representing natural forces. They performed rituals to gain favor from these deities. Over time, some thinkers began to explore the concept of a single spiritual power, leading to the development of mysticism.	['Aryans', 'polytheistic', 'worshipping', 'gods', 'representing', 'natural', 'forces', 'performed', 'rituals', 'gain', 'favor', 'deities', 'time', 'thinkers', 'began', 'explore', 'concept', 'single', 'spiritual', 'power', 'leading', 'development', 'mysticism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Epic Literature and Aryan Life	['Epic', 'Literature', 'Aryan', 'Life']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	By 500 B.C., Indian civilization was characterized by a blend of Aryan and Dravidian cultures. The Mahabharata and Ramayana are significant epics that reflect the values, beliefs, and historical narratives of the Aryans.	['Indian', 'civilization', 'characterized', 'blend', 'Aryan', 'Dravidian', 'cultures', 'Mahabharata', 'Ramayana', 'significant', 'epics', 'reflect', 'values', 'beliefs', 'historical', 'narratives', 'Aryans']

1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	3.2  Hinduism and Buddhism	['Hinduism', 'Buddhism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Hinduism and Buddhism are two major religions that originated in ancient India thousands of years ago. Both religions have significantly influenced Indian civilization through their ethical and spiritual teachings.	['Hinduism', 'Buddhism', 'two', 'major', 'religions', 'originated', 'ancient', 'India', 'thousands', 'years', 'ago', 'religions', 'significantly', 'influenced', 'Indian', 'civilization', 'ethical', 'spiritual', 'teachings']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Key Terms and Concepts	['Key', 'Terms', 'Concepts']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Atman: The essential self or soul in Hindu belief.	['Atman', 'essential', 'self', 'soul', 'Hindu', 'belief']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Caste: A social hierarchy in Hindu society.	['Caste', 'social', 'hierarchy', 'Hindu', 'society']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Moksha: The ultimate goal of life in Hinduism, representing union with Brahman.	['Moksha', 'ultimate', 'goal', 'life', 'Hinduism', 'representing', 'union', 'Brahman']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Reincarnation: The cycle of rebirth of the soul in different forms.	['Reincarnation', 'cycle', 'rebirth', 'soul', 'different', 'forms']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Siddhartha Gautama: The founder of Buddhism, known as the Buddha.	['Siddhartha', 'Gautama', 'founder', 'Buddhism', 'known', 'Buddha']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Four Noble Truths: The core principles of Buddhism that outline the nature of suffering.	['Four', 'Noble', 'Truths', 'core', 'principles', 'Buddhism', 'outline', 'nature', 'suffering']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Karma: The law of cause and effect in Hinduism and Buddhism.	['Karma', 'law', 'cause', 'effect', 'Hinduism', 'Buddhism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Eightfold Path: The path to enlightenment in Buddhism.	['Eightfold', 'Path', 'path', 'enlightenment', 'Buddhism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Dharma: The moral and religious duties of an individual in Hinduism.	['Dharma', 'moral', 'religious', 'duties', 'individual', 'Hinduism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Ahimsa: The principle of nonviolence in Hinduism.	['Ahimsa', 'principle', 'nonviolence', 'Hinduism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Nirvana: The ultimate goal in Buddhism, representing liberation from the cycle of rebirth.	['Nirvana', 'ultimate', 'goal', 'Buddhism', 'representing', 'liberation', 'cycle', 'rebirth']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Sect: A subgroup within a religion.	['Sect', 'subgroup', 'within', 'religion']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Development of Hinduism	['Development', 'Hinduism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Hinduism does not have a single founder or sacred text. It evolved from the beliefs of various groups in ancient India, particularly the Aryans and the Indus civilization. The religion encompasses a wide variety of gods and practices, with Brahman as the ultimate spiritual force.	['Hinduism', 'single', 'founder', 'sacred', 'text', 'evolved', 'beliefs', 'various', 'groups', 'ancient', 'India', 'particularly', 'Aryans', 'Indus', 'civilization', 'religion', 'encompasses', 'wide', 'variety', 'gods', 'practices', 'Brahman', 'ultimate', 'spiritual', 'force']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Hindu Sacred Texts	['Hindu', 'Sacred', 'Texts']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Vedas are the primary sacred texts of Hinduism, with the Upanishads addressing mystical questions. The Bhagavad-Gita is another important text that illustrates Hindu beliefs.	['Vedas', 'primary', 'sacred', 'texts', 'Hinduism', 'Upanishads', 'addressing', 'mystical', 'questions', 'another', 'important', 'text', 'illustrates', 'Hindu', 'beliefs']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Goals of Hinduism	['Goals', 'Hinduism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The ultimate goal for Hindus is to achieve moksha, or union with Brahman. This is accomplished by overcoming selfish desires and adhering to the law of karma. Reincarnation allows individuals to work towards moksha over multiple lifetimes.	['ultimate', 'goal', 'Hindus', 'achieve', 'moksha', 'union', 'Brahman', 'accomplished', 'overcoming', 'selfish', 'desires', 'adhering', 'law', 'karma', 'Reincarnation', 'allows', 'individuals', 'work', 'towards', 'moksha', 'multiple', 'lifetimes']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Principles of Hinduism	['Principles', 'Hinduism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Dharma: Religious and moral duties vary by class, occupation, gender, and age.	['Dharma', 'Religious', 'moral', 'duties', 'vary', 'class', 'occupation', 'gender', 'age']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Ahimsa: Nonviolence is a key moral principle, emphasizing respect for all living beings.	['Ahimsa', 'Nonviolence', 'key', 'moral', 'principle', 'emphasizing', 'respect', 'living', 'beings']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Caste System	['Caste', 'System']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The caste system in India is closely linked to Hindu beliefs, dividing society into hierarchical groups. Each caste has specific roles and responsibilities, and social mobility is limited. The system has historically included the "untouchables," now referred to as dalits, who faced severe discrimination.	['caste', 'system', 'India', 'closely', 'linked', 'Hindu', 'beliefs', 'dividing', 'society', 'hierarchical', 'groups', 'caste', 'specific', 'roles', 'responsibilities', 'social', 'mobility', 'limited', 'system', 'historically', 'included', 'untouchables', 'referred', 'dalits', 'faced', 'severe', 'discrimination']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Introduction to Buddhism	['Introduction', 'Buddhism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Buddhism emerged from Hindu traditions with Siddhartha Gautama as its founder. After witnessing human suffering, Gautama renounced his privileged life to seek enlightenment, ultimately becoming the Buddha.	['Buddhism', 'emerged', 'Hindu', 'traditions', 'Siddhartha', 'Gautama', 'founder', 'witnessing', 'human', 'suffering', 'Gautama', 'renounced', 'privileged', 'life', 'seek', 'enlightenment', 'ultimately', 'becoming', 'Buddha']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Four Noble Truths	['Four', 'Noble', 'Truths']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Central to Buddhism are the Four Noble Truths:	['Central', 'Buddhism', 'Four', 'Noble', 'Truths']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	All life is suffering.	['life', 'suffering']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The cause of suffering is nonvirtue.	['cause', 'suffering', 'nonvirtue']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The cure for suffering is to overcome nonvirtue.	['cure', 'suffering', 'overcome', 'nonvirtue']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The way to overcome nonvirtue is to follow the Eightfold Path.	['way', 'overcome', 'nonvirtue', 'follow', 'Eightfold', 'Path']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Eightfold Path	['Eightfold', 'Path']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Eightfold Path consists of:	['Eightfold', 'Path', 'consists']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Right views	['Right', 'views']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Right aspirations	['Right', 'aspirations']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Right speech	['Right', 'speech']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Right conduct	['Right', 'conduct']

1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Right mindfulness	['Right', 'mindfulness']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Right contemplation	['Right', 'contemplation']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Following this path leads to enlightenment and ultimately to nirvana.	['Following', 'path', 'leads', 'enlightenment', 'ultimately', 'nirvana']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Comparison of Buddhism and Hinduism	['Comparison', 'Buddhism', 'Hinduism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	While both religions share beliefs in karma, dharma, and reincarnation, they differ in their practices and focus. Buddhism emphasizes personal enlightenment through meditation and rejects the caste system, offering the hope of nirvana to all individuals regardless of their social status.	['religions', 'share', 'beliefs', 'karma', 'dharma', 'reincarnation', 'differ', 'practices', 'focus', 'Buddhism', 'emphasizes', 'personal', 'enlightenment', 'meditation', 'rejects', 'caste', 'system', 'offering', 'hope', 'nirvana', 'individuals', 'regardless', 'social', 'status']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Spread of Buddhism	['Spread', 'Buddhism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	After the Buddha's death, his teachings were compiled into the Tripitaka. Buddhism spread across Asia through missionaries and traders, evolving into two main sects: Theravada and Mahayana. Theravada Buddhism adheres closely to the original teachings, while Mahayana Buddhism adapts the teachings for broader appeal.	['Buddha', 'death', 'teachings', 'compiled', 'Tripitaka', 'Buddhism', 'spread', 'across', 'Asia', 'missionaries', 'traders', 'evolving', 'two', 'main', 'sects', 'Theravada', 'Mahayana', 'Theravada', 'Buddhism', 'adheres', 'closely', 'original', 'teachings', 'Mahayana', 'Buddhism', 'adapts', 'teachings', 'broader', 'appeal']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Decline of Buddhism in India	['Decline', 'Buddhism', 'India']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Despite its initial success, Buddhism gradually declined in India as Hinduism absorbed some of its ideas. By the 1100s, many Buddhist centers had disappeared due to invasions and the resurgence of Hindu practices.	['Despite', 'initial', 'success', 'Buddhism', 'gradually', 'declined', 'India', 'Hinduism', 'absorbed', 'ideas', 'many', 'Buddhist', 'centers', 'disappeared', 'due', 'invasions', 'resurgence', 'Hindu', 'practices']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	3.3 Powerful Empires of India	['Powerful', 'Empires', 'India']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Key Terms, People, and Places	['Key', 'Terms', 'People', 'Places']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Chandragupta Maurya: Founder of the Maurya Empire in ancient India.	['Chandragupta', 'Maurya', 'Founder', 'Maurya', 'Empire', 'ancient', 'India']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Dissent: Opposition to the prevailing authority or opinion.	['Dissent', 'Opposition', 'prevailing', 'authority', 'opinion']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Asoka: Third Mauryan emperor known for promoting Buddhism.	['Asoka', 'Third', 'Mauryan', 'emperor', 'known', 'promoting', 'Buddhism']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Missionary: A person who spreads their religious faith.	['Missionary', 'person', 'spreads', 'religious', 'faith']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Golden Age: A period of great cultural and economic achievement.	['Golden', 'Age', 'period', 'great', 'cultural', 'economic', 'achievement']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Decimal System: A base-10 numerical system.	['Decimal', 'System', 'numerical', 'system']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Joint Family: A family structure with multiple generations living together.	['Joint', 'Family', 'family', 'structure', 'multiple', 'generations', 'living', 'together']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Dowry: Property or money given by a bride's family to the groom's family at marriage.	['Dowry', 'Property', 'money', 'given', 'bride', 'family', 'groom', 'family', 'marriage']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Maurya Empire Creates a Strong Government	['Maurya', 'Empire', 'Creates', 'Strong', 'Government']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	In 321 B.C., Chandragupta Maurya established the first Indian empire amidst conflicts among rival rajahs in Northern India. His empire was documented by Megasthenes, a Greek ambassador, who described the capital Pataliputra as a city with schools, libraries, palaces, and temples, surrounded by a fortified wall with numerous towers and gates.	['Chandragupta', 'Maurya', 'established', 'first', 'Indian', 'empire', 'amidst', 'conflicts', 'among', 'rival', 'rajahs', 'Northern', 'India', 'empire', 'documented', 'Megasthenes', 'Greek', 'ambassador', 'described', 'capital', 'Pataliputra', 'city', 'schools', 'libraries', 'palaces', 'temples', 'surrounded', 'fortified', 'wall', 'numerous', 'towers', 'gates']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Chandragupta expanded his power from the Ganges valley to northern India and later into the Deccan region. The Maurya dynasty ruled from 321 B.C. to 185 B.C., maintaining order through a structured bureaucracy. Officials managed trade, collected taxes, and oversaw state-owned enterprises. Despite effective governance, Chandragupta's rule was marked by harshness, including a secret police force to monitor dissent and corruption.	['Chandragupta', 'expanded', 'power', 'Ganges', 'valley', 'northern', 'India', 'later', 'Deccan', 'region', 'Maurya', 'dynasty', 'ruled', 'maintaining', 'order', 'structured', 'bureaucracy', 'Officials', 'managed', 'trade', 'collected', 'taxes', 'oversaw', 'enterprises', 'Despite', 'effective', 'governance', 'Chandragupta', 'rule', 'marked', 'harshness', 'including', 'secret', 'police', 'force', 'monitor', 'dissent', 'corruption']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Asoka Rules by Moral Example	['Asoka', 'Rules', 'Moral', 'Example']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Asoka, Chandragupta's grandson, became the most revered Maurya emperor. After a devastating war in Kalinga, he converted to Buddhism, renouncing violence and committing to moral governance. He promoted respect for all life, limited animal sacrifices, and sent missionaries to spread Buddhism, fostering its growth across Asia while advocating for religious tolerance.	['Asoka', 'Chandragupta', 'grandson', 'became', 'revered', 'Maurya', 'emperor', 'devastating', 'war', 'Kalinga', 'converted', 'Buddhism', 'renouncing', 'violence', 'committing', 'moral', 'governance', 'promoted', 'respect', 'life', 'limited', 'animal', 'sacrifices', 'sent', 'missionaries', 'spread', 'Buddhism', 'fostering', 'growth', 'across', 'Asia', 'advocating', 'religious', 'tolerance']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Asoka erected stone pillars throughout India, offering moral guidance and promising just governance. His reign was characterized by peace, prosperity, and infrastructure development, including hospitals, shrines, and roads with amenities for travelers.	['Asoka', 'erected', 'stone', 'pillars', 'throughout', 'India', 'offering', 'moral', 'guidance', 'promising', 'governance', 'reign', 'characterized', 'peace', 'prosperity', 'infrastructure', 'development', 'including', 'hospitals', 'shrines', 'roads', 'amenities', 'travelers']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Division and Disunity	['Division', 'Disunity']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	After Asoka's death, the Maurya Empire fragmented due to internal strife and external pressures. The diverse cultural landscape of India, marked by geographical barriers and local rivalries, hindered long-term unity. The decline of the Maurya Empire led to the rise of various kingdoms in the Deccan region, each with distinct languages and traditions.	['Asoka', 'death', 'Maurya', 'Empire', 'fragmented', 'due', 'internal', 'strife', 'external', 'pressures', 'diverse', 'cultural', 'landscape', 'India', 'marked', 'geographical', 'barriers', 'local', 'rivalries', 'hindered', 'unity', 'decline', 'Maurya', 'Empire', 'led', 'rise', 'various', 'kingdoms', 'Deccan', 'region', 'distinct', 'languages', 'traditions']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Kingdoms Arise Across the Deccan	['Kingdoms', 'Arise', 'Across', 'Deccan']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Post-Maurya, the Deccan was divided into numerous kingdoms, each with its own capital and cultural identity. Tamil kingdoms in the south thrived on trade, exporting spices and textiles to the Roman Empire and later to China. The Tamil literary tradition flourished, capturing the essence of life and valor in their poetry.	['Deccan', 'divided', 'numerous', 'kingdoms', 'capital', 'cultural', 'identity', 'Tamil', 'kingdoms', 'south', 'thrived', 'trade', 'exporting', 'spices', 'textiles', 'Roman', 'Empire', 'later', 'China', 'Tamil', 'literary', 'tradition', 'flourished', 'capturing', 'essence', 'life', 'valor', 'poetry']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Guptas Bring About a Golden Age	['Guptas', 'Bring', 'Golden', 'Age']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Approximately 500 years after the Mauryas, the Gupta dynasty unified much of India from A.D. 320 to 540, marking a golden age of cultural achievement. The Gupta government was less centralized than the Maurya's, allowing local governance by villages and cities.	['Approximately', 'years', 'Mauryas', 'Gupta', 'dynasty', 'unified', 'much', 'India', 'marking', 'golden', 'age', 'cultural', 'achievement', 'Gupta', 'government', 'less', 'centralized', 'Maurya', 'allowing', 'local', 'governance', 'villages', 'cities']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Under Gupta rule, trade and agriculture thrived, with farmers cultivating various crops and artisans producing goods for local and international markets. The period saw significant advancements in learning, with institutions like Nalanda attracting students from across Asia to study diverse subjects.	['Gupta', 'rule', 'trade', 'agriculture', 'thrived', 'farmers', 'cultivating', 'various', 'crops', 'artisans', 'producing', 'goods', 'local', 'international', 'markets', 'period', 'saw', 'significant', 'advancements', 'learning', 'institutions', 'like', 'Nalanda', 'attracting', 'students', 'across', 'Asia', 'study', 'diverse', 'subjects']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Advancements in Arts and Sciences	['Advancements', 'Arts', 'Sciences']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Gupta era is renowned for its artistic achievements, including sculpture, painting, and literature. Artists created intricate temple carvings, while musicians and dancers flourished in royal courts. Indian mathematicians developed the numeral system and the concept of zero, which later influenced global mathematics.	['Gupta', 'era', 'renowned', 'artistic', 'achievements', 'including', 'sculpture', 'painting', 'literature', 'Artists', 'created', 'intricate', 'temple', 'carvings', 'musicians', 'dancers', 'flourished', 'royal', 'courts', 'Indian', 'mathematicians', 'developed', 'numeral', 'system', 'concept', 'zero', 'later', 'influenced', 'global', 'mathematics']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Literature also thrived, with notable works like Kalidasa's play "Shakuntala," which remains a classic. The Gupta period's contributions to medicine included advanced surgical techniques and early vaccination practices.	['Literature', 'also', 'thrived', 'notable', 'works', 'like', 'Kalidasa', 'play', 'Shakuntala', 'remains', 'classic', 'Gupta', 'period', 'contributions', 'medicine', 'included', 'advanced', 'surgical', 'techniques', 'early', 'vaccination', 'practices']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Gupta Empire Declines	['Gupta', 'Empire', 'Declines']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Eventually, the Gupta Empire weakened due to ineffective leadership, civil unrest, and invasions by the White Huns, leading to its fragmentation into smaller kingdoms. This marked a significant decline in centralized power in India for nearly a millennium.	['Eventually', 'Gupta', 'Empire', 'weakened', 'due', 'ineffective', 'leadership', 'civil', 'unrest', 'invasions', 'White', 'Huns', 'leading', 'fragmentation', 'smaller', 'kingdoms', 'marked', 'significant', 'decline', 'centralized', 'power', 'India', 'nearly', 'millennium']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Family and Village Life Shape Indian Society	['Family', 'Village', 'Life', 'Shape', 'Indian', 'Society']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Most Indians lived in villages, with daily life centered around family, caste, and community duties. The ideal family structure was a joint family, where extended family members lived together, headed by the oldest male. Family decisions were made collectively, emphasizing communal over individual interests.	['Indians', 'lived', 'villages', 'daily', 'life', 'centered', 'around', 'family', 'caste', 'community', 'duties', 'ideal', 'family', 'structure', 'joint', 'family', 'extended', 'family', 'members', 'lived', 'together', 'headed', 'oldest', 'male', 'Family', 'decisions', 'made', 'collectively', 'emphasizing', 'communal', 'individual', 'interests']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Role of Women and Social Structure	['Role', 'Women', 'Social', 'Structure']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Women's status varied over time, with early Aryan women enjoying more freedom than their later counterparts. By the Gupta period, upper-class women faced increasing restrictions, while lower-class women worked in fields. Marriage customs often involved dowries, and a woman's devotion to her husband was seen as a path to spiritual elevation.	['Women', 'status', 'varied', 'time', 'early', 'Aryan', 'women', 'enjoying', 'freedom', 'later', 'counterparts', 'Gupta', 'period', 'women', 'faced', 'increasing', 'restrictions', 'women', 'worked', 'fields', 'Marriage', 'customs', 'often', 'involved', 'dowries', 'woman', 'devotion', 'husband', 'seen', 'path', 'spiritual', 'elevation']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Village Governance and Economy	['Village', 'Governance', 'Economy']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Villages operated autonomously, governed by a headman and council, and were responsible for local projects. Agriculture was the backbone of the economy, reliant on monsoon rains, while trade facilitated the exchange of goods and ideas across regions.	['Villages', 'operated', 'autonomously', 'governed', 'headman', 'council', 'responsible', 'local', 'projects', 'Agriculture', 'backbone', 'economy', 'reliant', 'monsoon', 'rains', 'trade', 'facilitated', 'exchange', 'goods', 'ideas', 'across', 'regions']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Conclusion	['Conclusion']
1 G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The powerful empires of India, particularly the Maurya and Gupta dynasties, played a crucial role in shaping the subcontinent's history, culture, and societal structures. Their legacies continue to influence modern India.	['powerful', 'empires', 'India', 'particularly', 'Maurya', 'Gupta', 'dynasties', 'played', 'crucial', 'role', 'shaping', 'subcontinent', 'history', 'culture', 'societal', 'structures', 'legacies', 'continue', 'influence', 'modern', 'India']

3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	9.1 The Byzantine Empire	['Byzantine', 'Empire']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Constantinople was strategically located at the intersection of land and sea routes, which contributed to its immense wealth from trade. The city's leaders constructed strong defenses, allowing it to thrive while other cities in the western Roman Empire fell into decline.	['Constantinople', 'strategically', 'located', 'intersection', 'land', 'sea', 'routes', 'contributed', 'immense', 'wealth', 'trade', 'city', 'leaders', 'constructed', 'strong', 'defenses', 'allowing', 'thrive', 'cities', 'western', 'Roman', 'Empire', 'fell', 'decline']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	High walls and golden domes symbolized its status as the capital of the Byzantine Empire.	['High', 'walls', 'golden', 'domes', 'symbolized', 'status', 'capital', 'Byzantine', 'Empire']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Constantine rebuilt Byzantium and renamed it Constantinople in 330 AD, establishing it as the new capital.	['Constantine', 'rebuilt', 'Byzantium', 'renamed', 'Constantinople', 'AD', 'establishing', 'new', 'capital']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Roads radiated from Constantinople to the Balkans, Middle East, and North Africa.	['Roads', 'radiated', 'Constantinople', 'Balkans', 'Middle', 'East', 'North', 'Africa']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Byzantine Empire's Growth	['Byzantine', 'Empire', 'Growth']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Constantinople became the vital center of the Byzantine Empire, located on the Bosporus strait, linking the Mediterranean and Black seas. The city was well-defended by water on three sides and had a bustling marketplace.	['Constantinople', 'became', 'vital', 'center', 'Byzantine', 'Empire', 'located', 'Bosporus', 'strait', 'linking', 'Mediterranean', 'Black', 'seas', 'city', 'water', 'three', 'sides', 'bustling', 'marketplace']

3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Byzantine emperors lived in luxury, attending chariot races at the Hippodrome, reflecting the city's Roman heritage.	['Byzantine', 'emperors', 'lived', 'luxury', 'attending', 'chariot', 'races', 'Hippodrome', 'reflecting', 'city', 'Roman', 'heritage']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Decline and Cultural Blending	['Decline', 'Cultural', 'Blending']

3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Challenges and Decline	['Challenges', 'Decline']

3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Q1. Who was Constantine? What did he accomplish?	['Constantine', 'accomplish']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Roman emperor Constantine and his successors shifted their base to the eastern mediterranean. 	['Roman', 'emperor', 'Constantine', 'successors', 'shifted', 'base', 'eastern', 'mediterranean']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Constantine rebuilt the Greek city of Byzantium then renamed it after himself—Constantinople. Through this time, roads fanned out and the Eastern Roman Empire became known as the Byzantine Empire. 3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Q2. How did Constantinople become a rich and powerful city?	['Constantinople', 'become', 'rich', 'powerful', 'city']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The vital center and capital of the empire was Constantinople, located on the shore of the Bosporus, a strait that links the Mediterranean and Black seas. Constantinople had an excellent harbor and was guarded on three sides by water as well as sea walls on a high land to bolster its defenses.	['vital', 'center', 'capital', 'empire', 'Constantinople', 'located', 'shore', 'Bosporus', 'strait', 'links', 'Mediterranean', 'Black', 'seas', 'Constantinople', 'excellent', 'harbor', 'guarded', 'three', 'sides', 'water', 'well', 'sea', 'walls', 'high', 'land', 'bolster', 'defenses']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Constantinople gained its wealth through commanding key trade routes linking Europe and Asia, making it a busy marketplace and a center of cultural distributions, as it blends ancient Greek, Roman, and Christian influences with other traditions of the Mediterranean world. 	['Constantinople', 'gained', 'wealth', 'commanding', 'key', 'trade', 'routes', 'linking', 'Europe', 'Asia', 'making', 'busy', 'marketplace', 'center', 'cultural', 'distributions', 'blends', 'ancient', 'Greek', 'Roman', 'Christian', 'influences', 'traditions', 'Mediterranean', 'world']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Q3. What are Justinian’s accomplishments?	['Justinian', 'accomplishments']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	The Byzantine Empire reached to its peak under the rule of the emperor Justinian, who ruled from 527 to 565. Justinian launched a construction project to restore the Byzantine empire back to its past glories. He created countless cities, buildings, and churches including the Hagia Sophia (Meaning “Holy Wisdom”, topped with a spherical-shaped dome and serves as a cathedral of Eastern Orthodox Christianity, Roman Christian cathedral, and Islamic Mosque). He established the firm foundations of a single faith and preserved laws in the Code of Justinian that unified the empire.	['Byzantine', 'Empire', 'reached', 'peak', 'rule', 'emperor', 'Justinian', 'ruled', 'Justinian', 'launched', 'construction', 'project', 'restore', 'Byzantine', 'empire', 'back', 'past', 'glories', 'created', 'countless', 'cities', 'buildings', 'churches', 'including', 'Hagia', 'Sophia', 'Meaning', 'Holy', 'Wisdom', 'topped', 'dome', 'serves', 'cathedral', 'Eastern', 'Orthodox', 'Christianity', 'Roman', 'Christian', 'cathedral', 'Islamic', 'Mosque', 'established', 'firm', 'foundations', 'single', 'faith', 'preserved', 'laws', 'Code', 'Justinian', 'unified', 'empire']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Q4. How did Eastern and Western churches differ?	['Eastern', 'Western', 'churches', 'differ']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	In Western churches, Rome was the main city. The pope claimed reign after all Christians and spoke Latin as their main language. Christmas was a major holiday. 	['Western', 'churches', 'Rome', 'main', 'city', 'pope', 'claimed', 'reign', 'Christians', 'spoke', 'Latin', 'main', 'language', 'Christmas', 'major', 'holiday']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	In Eastern Churches, Constantinople was the main city. The Byzantine Emperor controlled church affairs and appointed the patriarch. Byzantine Christians rejected the pope’s authority and clergies were allowed to marry. They spoke Greek and viewed Easter as a more important holiday.	['Eastern', 'Churches', 'Constantinople', 'main', 'city', 'Byzantine', 'Emperor', 'controlled', 'church', 'affairs', 'appointed', 'patriarch', 'Byzantine', 'Christians', 'rejected', 'pope', 'authority', 'clergies', 'allowed', 'marry', 'spoke', 'Greek', 'viewed', 'Easter', 'important', 'holiday']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	 	[]
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Q5. What Was the Great Schism? 	['Great', 'Schism']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	 The differences between religious beliefs, practices, and use of icons provoked a schism, or split, between the Eastern and Western Christianity, known as the Great Schism. The Eastern Byzantine church became known as the Greek Orthodox Church, while the Western church became known as the Roman Catholic Church. They treated each other as rivals.	['differences', 'religious', 'beliefs', 'practices', 'use', 'icons', 'provoked', 'schism', 'split', 'Eastern', 'Western', 'Christianity', 'known', 'Great', 'Schism', 'Eastern', 'Byzantine', 'church', 'became', 'known', 'Greek', 'Orthodox', 'Church', 'Western', 'church', 'became', 'known', 'Roman', 'Catholic', 'Church', 'treated', 'rivals']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Q6. What Factors Led to the Fall of the Byzantine Empire? 	['Factors', 'Led', 'Fall', 'Byzantine', 'Empire']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:37	Struggles over succession, court intrigues, and constant wars undermined the empire’s strength. THE Byzantine’s emperor called the Western help to fight the Seljuks, whose attacks blacked the pilgrimage routes to Jerusalem, resulting in the first crusade. During the next crusades, trade sparked violence between the Byzantine Empire and Venice, a city-state in northern Italy. Venetian merchants persuaded soldiers to attack Constantinople in the fourth crusade. The crusaders burned and plunged the city, controlling the Byzantine trade, draining the empire’s wealth.          	['Struggles', 'succession', 'court', 'intrigues', 'constant', 'wars', 'undermined', 'empire', 'strength', 'Byzantine', 'emperor', 'called', 'Western', 'help', 'fight', 'Seljuks', 'whose', 'attacks', 'blacked', 'pilgrimage', 'routes', 'Jerusalem', 'resulting', 'first', 'crusade', 'next', 'crusades', 'trade', 'sparked', 'violence', 'Byzantine', 'Empire', 'Venice', 'northern', 'Italy', 'Venetian', 'merchants', 'persuaded', 'soldiers', 'attack', 'Constantinople', 'fourth', 'crusade', 'crusaders', 'burned', 'plunged', 'city', 'controlling', 'Byzantine', 'trade', 'draining', 'empire', 'wealth']

3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Muhammad was known for his honesty in business and was a devoted husband father. He was troubled by the moral ills of society, especially greed. 3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Q3. What are the duties required of Muslims?	['duties', 'required', 'Muslims']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	All Muslims preform the 5 pillars of Islam. The first is to make a declaration of faith, the second is to pray 5 times daily in a house of worship called mosque. The third is to give charity to the poor, or Almsgiving, and the third is Fasting between dawn and sunset in the month of Ramadan. Lastly, the fifth is to make the hajji, or pilgrimage to Mecca. Additionally, Jihad is a personal duty for Islam, or struggle in God’s service. 3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Q1. What achievements did Muslims make in economics, art, literature, and science?	['achievements', 'Muslims', 'make', 'economics', 'art', 'literature', 'science']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Between 750 and 1350, merchants built a vast trading network across Muslim lands and beyond. They crossed the Sahara Desert in Africa, East Asia, and Europe on the Silk Road spreading products, technologies, knowledge and culture. Manufactured goods were highly valued. Muslim artisans produced a wealth of fine goods. 3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Q2. What business practices were pioneered by merchants in Muslim lands?	['business', 'practices', 'pioneered', 'merchants', 'Muslim', 'lands']

['Extensive', 'trade', 'money', 'economy', 'led', 'Muslims', 'pioneer', 'new', 'business', 'practices', 'created', 'partnerships', 'bought', 'sold', 'credit', 'formed', 'banks', 'major', 'cities', 'check', 'written', 'Baghdad', 'might', 'cashed', 'Cairo']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Q3. What elements characterized Muslim art?	['elements', 'characterized', 'Muslim', 'art']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Muslim art reflected diverse traditions of the various people and distinctive style. Artists were forbidden to use human or animal figures in religious art. Quran is a very important source for Muslim literature such as poetry. Most of the religious buildings were decorated with arabesque of abstract geometric patterns and calligraphy mosques had a dome and arches – Byzantine style.	['Muslim', 'art', 'reflected', 'diverse', 'traditions', 'various', 'people', 'distinctive', 'style', 'Artists', 'forbidden', 'use', 'human', 'animal', 'figures', 'religious', 'art', 'Quran', 'important', 'source', 'Muslim', 'literature', 'poetry', 'religious', 'buildings', 'decorated', 'arabesque', 'abstract', 'geometric', 'patterns', 'calligraphy', 'mosques', 'dome', 'arches', 'Byzantine', 'style']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Q4. Why did Islam prohibit the depiction of people or animals in religious art?	['Islam', 'prohibit', 'depiction', 'people', 'animals', 'religious', 'art']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	The Quran strictly banned the worship of idols and Muslim religious leaders forbade artists to portray God or human figures in religious art, giving Islamic art a distinctive style. 	['Quran', 'strictly', 'banned', 'worship', 'idols', 'Muslim', 'religious', 'leaders', 'forbade', 'artists', 'portray', 'God', 'human', 'figures', 'religious', 'art', 'giving', 'Islamic', 'art', 'distinctive', 'style']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Q5. How did Muslim scholars preserve and build on the learning of earlier civilizations?	['Muslim', 'scholars', 'preserve', 'build', 'learning', 'earlier', 'civilizations']
3 IDX G9 HIST S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	They achieved it by collecting classical works of ancient Greeks, Romans, Persians, and other early civilizations into libraries, translating them into Arabic and expanding the ideas within. They also helped spread Arabic numerals which was invented by ancient Indians. 	['achieved', 'collecting', 'classical', 'works', 'ancient', 'Greeks', 'Romans', 'Persians', 'early', 'civilizations', 'libraries', 'translating', 'Arabic', 'expanding', 'ideas', 'within', 'also', 'helped', 'spread', 'Arabic', 'numerals', 'invented', 'ancient', 'Indians']

4 IDX G9 HIST H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Sunni-Shi’a Conflict	['Conflict']
4 IDX G9 HIST H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Origins of the Split: The Sunni-Shi’a divide began after Muhammad’s death in 632 CE over the rightful successor. Sunnis supported Abu Bakr, a close companion of Muhammad, while Shi’as believed leadership should remain within Muhammad’s family, supporting Ali, his cousin and son-in-law. 4 IDX G9 HIST H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Sunni Beliefs: Leadership should be chosen by consensus or election among the Muslim community; they form the majority of Muslims worldwide. 4 IDX G9 HIST H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Shi’a Beliefs: Leadership (Imamate) should remain within Muhammad’s bloodline, with Ali and his descendants as rightful leaders. 5 IDX G9 HIST S+.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	After the Han dynasty collapsed in 220, China remained divided for nearly 400 years. During the brief period of the Sui dynasty (589-618), China was unified by the South and North, but the glory was not restored until the emergence of the Tang dynasty in 618. 6 IDX G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	答案：恐怖压抑，寂静鬼气森。	[]

6 IDX G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	答案：先是鲜血，再是血，黑白场景中红尤为显眼，令人毛骨悚然，象征生命、死亡、革命者的牺牲。	[]
6 IDX G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Q2老栓出门环境描写有何特点，对于塑造人物有何作用？	[]
6 IDX G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	答案：老栓在这么压抑的氛围中觉得爽快，暗示当时社会黑暗。后面的路越来越亮，	代表了老栓的希望，以喜写悲，体现了老栓的愚昧无知。	[]
6 IDX G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Q3结合文章中的下列细节，分析华老栓在去买 “人血馒头” 时的心情，以及为何有这样的心情。	['人血馒头']
6 IDX G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	（1）天气比屋子里冷多了；老栓倒觉爽快，仿佛一旦变了少年，得了神通，有给人	生命的本领似的，跨步格外高远。	[]
6 IDX G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	心情：轻快、兴奋	[]
6 IDX G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	原因：认为人血馒头就能救小栓，所以高兴。	[]
6 IDX G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	（2）老栓又吃一惊，睁眼看时，几个人从他面前过去了。一个还回头看他，样子不甚分明，但很像久饿的人见了食物一般，眼里闪出一种攫取的光。	[]
6 IDX G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	心情：吃惊、害怕	[]
6 IDX G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	原因：周围围观的看客的群众都是 “吃人” 者，暗示老栓的麻木。	['吃人']
6 IDX G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	（3）老栓慌忙摸出洋钱，抖抖的想交给他，却又不敢去接他的东西。	[]
6 IDX G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	心情：紧张、害怕	[]
6 IDX G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	原因：第一次买人血馒头，本能的害怕。	[]

1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	字词：	[]
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	乖僻是指性格或行为古怪，偏离常规，令人难以接近。“他性格乖僻，常与人保持距离，不愿交流，总是独来独往。”	[]
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	踌躇是指犹豫不决，拿不定主意，停留不前。“面对未来的选择，他显得踌躇不前，十分犹豫。”	[]
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	暌违是指长时间分离或不见。“他们毕业后暌违多年，再次相见时感慨万分。”	[]
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“我”的“天才”从哪里能看得出来？从中能看出张爱玲的哪些梦和哪些特征？	['我', '的', '天才']

1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“咬啮性”：啃啮着灵魂，心灵	['咬啮性']

1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	《荷塘月色》	[]
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	朱自清	['朱自清']
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	朱自清，家乡是扬州，现代接触的作家、教育家、学者、民主战士。参与发起新文学史上第一个诗歌团体“中国新诗社”，创办第一个诗歌杂志《诗》期刊。1930年代，留学英国、漫游欧洲五国，写成《伦敦杂记》以及《欧游杂记》。朱自清在清华开设中国新文学研究课程，总结五四运动以来十年间中国新文学取得的成果，也是至今中国大学现代文化研究课程的源头；在朱自清的倡导下，清华大学的人文学科形成了“古今贯通，中西融汇，文理会通”的学术氛围，被称为“清华学派”。	['中国新诗社', '清华学派']
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	字词：	[]
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	霎时的读音是 shà shí。意思是极短的时间，形容事情发生得非常迅速。常用来表示某个动作或情景在一瞬间或短时间内发生或改变。	['霎时的读音是', 'shà']
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	蓊郁的读音是 wěng yù。整体的意思是形容树木、花草等非常繁茂、茂盛，生机勃勃，通常用于描写自然环境的美好、富饶。	['蓊郁的读音是', 'wěng']
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	袅娜的读音是 niǎo nuó。形容姿态柔美、轻盈、优雅。常用于描写女性的身姿轻柔、婀娜多姿。	['袅娜的读音是', 'niǎo']
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	脉脉的读音是 mò mò。指含情默默、深情款款的样子，形容一个人内心有感情却不直接表达，往往通过眼神、动作等流露出温柔、深情的情感。也可以形容事物悄然流动、静静地传递的样子	['脉脉的读音是', 'mò']
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	倩影指的是美丽的身影，多用于形容女子的优美、动人的姿态或身形。这个词含有褒义，通常表达对人物外形的欣赏和赞美，尤其是女子的美丽姿态。	[]
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	斑驳指的是色彩杂乱、参差不齐的样子。	[]
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	全文梳理	['全文梳理']
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	-全文情景交触，以景带情，景中含情。	[]
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	-空间顺序描写：出门（起）=>小路，独处的妙处（承，转）=>荷塘月色（转）=>想江南（转）=>回家（合）	[]
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	-明线：作者的空间移动，行动路线；家=>小路=>荷塘月色=>家	['家']
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	-暗线：作者的心路轨迹；不静=>寻静=>得静=>出静	['出静']
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	文章中为什么要引用《采莲赋》和《西洲曲》中关于采莲风俗的描写?	[]
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	古代采莲风俗象征着理想中的美好、欢愉，而现实中作者却无法体验到那样的快乐。	[]
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	通过引用古代采莲风俗，作者表达了对美好生活的向往与现实中的失落感。在文章中，作者虽然置身于美丽的荷塘，但心中却颇不宁静。这种理想与现实的对比加强了主题表达，使得作者内心的情感波动与外界的宁静自然相互映衬，突显出对理想生活的追寻和现实中的无奈情感。	[]
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	文章中作者的情感脉络是如何发展的?宁静的荷塘与不宁静的内心是否矛盾?	['文章中作者的情感脉络是如何发展的', '宁静的荷塘与不宁静的内心是否矛盾']
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	不静=>寻静=>得静=>出静	['出静']
1 G9 CHI S.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	并不矛盾，因为二者表现了外在环境与内在情感的对照和反差，反映了作者内心的复杂情绪。这种矛盾更深刻地揭示了作者的心境：虽然渴望宁静，但在现实面前，内心依旧充满波动。这种对比反而加深了文章的情感表达，让读者感受到作者内心的复杂与深沉。	[]

1 G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	《野渡》：请阅读以下材料，分析下列问题。	[]
1 G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	材料1：（2023·上海市委日报·柯灵——应是屐齿印苍苔）柯灵先生的文学成就是多方面的。他写剧本，写小说，写评论，写杂文，写散文。他担任编剧的电影《不夜城》，曾经在中国引起轰动，从影片中透露出的深沉曲折的历史感和浓郁的艺术气息使人折服。柯灵的序文，不仅是美文，而且表达了很多对文学、对历史、对社会的真知灼见。譬如在写于1981年的一篇序文《文学没有真空》中，他指出：“闭关锁国，思想壅塞的结果，是既看不见世界，也看不见自己，文学上的某些倒流现象就是如此。”他这样议论：“嘘气成云，飞唾为雨，一窝风的习惯势力长期在我们生活中占着优势。酷爱绝对化，不承认人的多样，世界的多样，事物的多样，不企求多渠道、多层次、多方位、多形势的多样统一。不相信‘人之向善，谁不如我’这种平凡的真理。热衷于举世诺诺，不容一士谔谔。这种宿疾，该到下决心根治的时候了。”	[]
1 G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	材料2：1930 年的中国处于一个军阀混战的时期。这一年的 5 月，蒋阎冯大战爆发，蒋介石与冯玉祥、李宗仁、阎锡山在河北、山东和河南大地上混战。这场战争导致国内局势进一步动荡，民众疲于战乱，生活困苦……1930 年的中国正面临着严重的经济困境。国内工业产值下降，农业生产遭受打击，市场萧条，物价上涨，民众生活陷入困境。	[]
1 G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	1930 年的中国同时面临着列强的压迫与侵略。此外，日本在这一年加大对华北的侵略力度，6 月，日本军队在北平成立反蒋派国民政府，企图分裂中国，扶植亲日政权。这一事件进一步凸显了当时中国所面临的严峻国际形势。	[]
1 G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	请结合以上文献与《野渡》作品相融合，你认为隐宓于《野渡》一文层层迷雾背后的作者以及创作背景是怎样的？	[]

1 G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	材料1：（节选自杨绛著《干校六记》）：（1）默存过菜园，我指着窝棚说：“给咱们这样一个棚，咱们就住下，行吗？”默存认真想了一下说：“没有书。”真的，什么物质享受，全都罢得；没有书却不好过日子。（2）冬天日短，他们拉着空车回去的时候，已经暮色苍茫。荒凉的连片菜地阒无一人。我慢慢儿跑到埋人的地方，只看见添了一个扁扁的土馒头。谁也不会注意到溪岸上多了这么一个新坟。	[]

4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	《孔乙己》	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	作者信息：	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	鲁迅（1881-1936），原名周樟寿，字豫才，后改名周树人，出生于浙江绍兴	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	家中长子，很小就担负家庭重担，接触残酷的社会	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	少年时接受过传统教育，后到南京上学堂，接受西式教育	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	1902官费留学日本，原在仙台医学院学医，后决定弃医从文，认为当务之急是改变国民的思想	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	1909回国后，曾在教育部任职	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	1918年五四运动时期，受钱玄同邀请，为《新青年》杂志写作《狂人日记》	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	《狂人日记》首次用“鲁迅”的笔名，是中国现代文学史上第一篇白话小说	['鲁迅']
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	自此之后，撰写了大量的小说、杂文和散文等等，批判旧思想、旧道德，成为新文化运动的领军者之一	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	1926年，因支持北京学生爱国运动，被政府所通缉，南下到厦门大学、中山大学任教	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	1927年10月到达上海，参加中国自由运动大同盟，中国左翼作家联盟和中国民权保障同盟	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	1936年10月19日病逝于上海	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	1918-1926年间，出版小说集《呐喊》，《彷徨》，散文诗集《野草》，散文集《朝花夕拾》，杂文集《热风》	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	1927-1936年创作历史小说集《故事新编》中大部分作品，大量杂文收集在《而已集》	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	字词：	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	倘 （tāng）  舀（yǎo）孱水（chàn） 阔绰（chuò） 拭去（shì） 茴香豆（huí）  	['倘']
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	蘸（zhàn） 打折了腿 （shé） 大抵   恳切    颓唐   不屑置辩 	['打折了腿', '大抵', '恳切', '颓唐', '不屑置辩']
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	体裁：小说 – 以刻画人物形象为中心，通过完整的故事情节和环境描写来反映社会生活的文学体裁。	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	第一段介绍故事发生的地点在鲁镇的咸亨酒店，介绍了酒店的环境（社会环境）。穿长衫的人指的是有文化有钱的上等人，穿短衣的人指的是干体力活的下等人；突出了当时社会等级的森严	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	人物形象	['人物形象']
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	孔乙己：他即不是一个完美的受害者，因为他不会营生而且好喝懒做，所以才会穷困潦倒。但他同时也不是一个完全的坏人，因为他从不拖欠，比其他人要好；而且虽然会做小偷小摸的事情，但是他不偷钱，只是偷书。他试图在用一种不太正确的行为弥补他心中的社会地位和理想间的落差，但他不愿意承认它作为读书人的堕落，放不下自己读书人的架子。	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	短衣帮们与掌柜： 掌柜爱耍小聪明，因为他会在酒里孱水为了降低成本；他对小伙计也是一脸凶恶的模样；而他对孔乙己也是高高在上的态度	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“我”：我是孔乙己故事的旁观者和见证人，但是即便如此，“我”年纪轻轻却丧失了应有的良知，对孔乙己不仅没有怜悯和同情，反而常常取笑他；但是社会的冷漠和麻木，让“我”一个小小的伙计也对孔乙己的不幸表现出兴趣和对痛苦的敏感	['我', '我', '我', '一个小小的伙计也对孔乙己的不幸表现出兴趣和对痛苦的敏感']
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	句子分析	['句子分析']
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“只有孔乙己到店，才可以笑几声，所以至今还记得。”（3）	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	承上启下	['承上启下']
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“孔乙己是站着喝酒而穿长衫的唯一的人。”（4）	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	道出孔乙己的生存困境：实际上已经跌落到劳动阶层（中下层），但是仍固执地不肯面对和承认	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“‘你怎的连半个秀才也捞不到呢？’孔乙己立刻显出颓唐不安模样，连上笼上了一层灰色，嘴里说些话；这回可是全是之乎者也之类，一些不懂了。”（6）	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	没有考取功名是孔乙己的心结，他无法争辩，只能支吾搪塞	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“引得众人都哄笑起来：店内外充满了快活的空气。”（4）	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“众人也都哄笑起来：店内外充满了快活的空气。”（6）	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“孔乙己是这样的使人快活，可是没有他，别人也变这么过。”（9）	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	在他们看来孔乙己是可有可无的，他们并不真正关心孔乙己，后文还展现了人们的冷漠和恶毒	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“众人”是指店里喝酒的短衣帮们和掌柜店伙计等人，他们取笑孔乙己不光彩的行为（伤疤、偷东西、被打等），也嘲笑他没有考取秀才；他们以激怒孔乙己为目的，看到孔乙己的着急和不安，从中获得快乐。借助短衣帮们的笑声和他们在捉弄人中获得的快活，既表现了孔乙己的可怜可悲，更揭示了短衣帮们的无聊、空虚（和麻木冷漠）	['众人']
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“中秋之后，秋风是一天凉比一天，看看将近初冬；我整天的靠着火，也须穿上棉袄了。”（11）	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	环境描写：初冬的天气，萧瑟寒冷，营造出了悲凉的氛围，为受伤后的孔乙己的最后出场做出铺垫	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“我到现在终于没有见----大约孔乙己的确死了”	['我到现在终于没有见', '大约孔乙己的确死了']
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“大约”：“我”的确不知道孔乙己的实际情况，也暗示“我”对此不关心；“的确”：在当时的环境下，孔乙己的结局凶多吉少。两个表面矛盾的词义背后，是人们对一个微小生命的去留的漠不关心	['大约', '我', '我', '的确']
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	写作手法：白描	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	主题：	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	孔乙己的可怜可悲以及可笑	['孔乙己的可怜可悲以及可笑']
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	刻画短衣帮们（看客们）的无聊空虚，以及冷漠和麻木	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	借助掌柜和喝酒人的对话来交代孔乙己被打的情节不但可以刻画掌柜和喝酒人的形象，也可以使故事的场景集中在咸亨酒店里	[]
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	从“我”的视角叙述可以采用有限的视角，仅从酒店小伙计的角度讲述故事，把故事的时空、场景、都控制在酒店内 ；二是形成客观中立的态度，在“我”与酒店中的所有人之间，形成一种“看”和“被看”的叙事关系；三是“我”的形象的意义:其实也是一个独立的形象	['从', '我', '我', '看', '和', '被看', '我', '的形象的意义', '其实也是一个独立的形象']
4 IDX G9 CHI H.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	写作意图：作者以极俭省的笔墨和典型的生活细节，塑造了孔乙己这个沦落到社会底层、生活穷困潦倒、最终被残酷的现实所吞没的读书人形象；小说既批判了深受旧科举制度毒害的读书人的清高迂腐可笑，丧失了基本的劳动能力，也借助其处境和遭遇，揭示了旧封建社会的世态炎凉和人们对不幸者的麻木和冷酷，反映了封建社会的腐朽和病态	[]

5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	文章梳理：	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	第一节	['第一节']
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	华家卧室和街头。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	在叙事上制造了悬念吸引读者，渲染了阴森压抑的氛围，突出了华老栓愚昧又充满希望的状态，也批判了人民的封建迷信。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	老栓认为有了救小栓性命的方法，所以觉得“爽快”，体现了老栓激动和满怀希望的心情。购买人血馒头给小栓吃，即可药到病除。老栓的心理描写，表现出了他的兴奋，充满期待和希望。	['爽快']
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	他通过描写看客们伸长脖子围观的状态以及刽子手的凶狠形象、交接人血馒头的动作等侧面呈现。这种写法批判了看客们的麻木愚昧，揭示了封建统治下民众的精神劣根性。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	1）老栓——动作描写，反映出来华家经济拮据，以及老栓胆小懦弱。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	黑衣人——动作描写，“抢”“扯”“裹”“塞”表现出了他动作的熟练。“抓”和“捏一捏”表现出了他的急切，刽子手的凶横、残暴有贪婪、卑劣的个性。	['抢', '扯', '裹', '塞', '抓', '和', '捏一捏']
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	2）比喻——“潮一般前进”“仿佛许多鸭”，表现了人们的凶狠和麻木。	['潮一般前进', '仿佛许多鸭']
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	动作描写——白描式地、漫画式地刻画了人们看热闹的着急、入迷以及害怕，刻画了他们精神上的愚昧、无知和冷漠、麻木。	[]

5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	华家：店面、灶下、里屋。	[]

5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	第三节	['第三节']
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	华家的茶馆里。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	刽子手——玄色布衫和腰带；满脸横肉；“你运气，要不是我消息”；众人的恭敬和讨好。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	消息灵通人士——与华家相熟（进门就嚷道…）；刽子手“浑身黑色”，眼光像刀地刺向老栓；拿到钱就哼着“这老东西”…	['浑身黑色', '这老东西']
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	黑眼眶——外貌	笑嘻嘻——神态	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	暗示了虽然他们表面上恭恭敬敬的，维持着高兴的神态，他们心中却充满忧患；侧面写出了小栓病情并未好转。面对康大叔，华家又不敢质疑，体现了他们的愚昧守旧。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“不高兴”是因为“痨病”通常指治不好的病，因此康大叔当众谈论小栓的病是对华家一家人的不尊重。又“立刻堆上笑”是因为正是因为康大叔消息灵通，小栓吃上了人血馒头；华家感激不已，不敢得罪。	['不高兴', '是因为', '痨病', '立刻堆上笑']
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“他”指夏瑜。“你”指茶客们。这句话是反问句，暗示了说话者认为革命者们的想法是发了疯的想法。反映出了众人的愚昧不知、麻木冷漠。	['他', '你']
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	夏三爷举报自己家里人是革命者，被赏了银钱，避免了夏家男丁满门抄斩。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	语言描写——低声下气、附和、阿谀奉承、愚昧、麻木、冷漠。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	通过茶客们的闲聊，不但可以刻画民众的人物形象，还能让读者了解华家的故事以及背后的夏家的故事。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	1）动作、外貌——康大叔的粗俗、贪婪、蛮横、精明世故、夸夸其谈、势利、愚昧麻木冷漠。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	2）神态、动作——地位低下，身份卑微，表现其恭顺/恭敬、懦弱（带有奴隶思想作祟的卑躯屈膝）。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	第四节	['第四节']
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	场景安排在墓地（城外的官地）	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	此比喻的喻体是馒头，本体是坟墓，本体和喻体相似在形状上，而且都是层层叠叠的。革命者的血沾了馒头被底层民众当作药吃了，展现了人们的麻木愚昧。都会给革命者和底层人民带来悲剧，给亲人带来痛苦，与当政者既得到利益者的喜悦，热闹形成对比，揭示了当时社会的阶级化不公，令人感到社会的冷漠麻木与人生的无奈。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	因为她要祭拜的坟在左边，显然她祭拜的人是囚犯，“羞愧”一词展现了她并不理解她的儿子，感到羞愧，“踌躇”展现了她的经济状况并不好。	['羞愧', '踌躇']
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“老女人”这样是因为她发现儿子的坟上有一个花圈，不知花圈所蕴含的深意，反而认为是屈死的儿子显灵了。	['老女人']
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	因为她看到别人家亲人的坟头上有整齐的花，自己家亲人的坟头上却没有，有些失落和不满足。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	夏瑜坟上的花可能是其他人来祭拜夏瑜时献上的。花圈并非死者显灵，也根本不可能死者显灵因而让乌鸦飞上坟头的事情发生。那个花圈象征着革命者的希望与传承，他的血被人们拿来做“药”，而且他的牺牲也并没有被当时的社会所理解，花圈表明了对夏瑜的敬意和悼念。	['药']
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	因为夏瑜被捕，处刑，所以夏家的亲戚都不跟夏家来往了，展现了人们的世态炎凉。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	跟上文“心里感到不足和空虚”相互呼应。无论这花圈是因为死者显灵还是什么原因，老女人的一番话后，周围一片死寂，没有任何回应表明花跟死者有关，所以华大妈之前的心理落差消失了。	['跟上文', '心里感到不足和空虚']
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	钟摆》（马来西亚）朵拉	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	文章梳理：	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	开篇的环境描写只是客观的描写了黄昏下雨天黑得很早的事实，内容简略，语言简洁，能让小说情节展开更加迅速。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“生活里没有期待，也没有新奇”，“每个新的一天，都是旧日子的延续。。。”全文围绕这两个句子将钟摆的一生和人的一生完美地衔接在一起。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	 暗示了李文启并不真的期待与妻子互动，他买钟并非想给妻子惊喜，也表现了李文启对妻子很 少表达情感和爱意	['少表达情感和爱意']
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	说明李文启比较随性，自我。“喜滋滋”运用了神态描写，刻画了他此刻对自己的购物收获的心满意足。	['喜滋滋']
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	 “他的喜悦”突出了他买东西是为了满足自己。	['他的喜悦']
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	“的儿嗒…一个上午过去了”和下面两段是重复的，借助人和钟摆的镜像并置，暗示人如钟摆的处境：林佳如在家中的孤独，孤单，生活的乏味。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	 借助梦境的手法，将人物的潜意识加以揭示，强化人物生存状态中的“毫无变化”，乏味和重复，并揭示人物内心的恐惧。	['毫无变化']
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	 超现实手法的运用，揭示乏味，重复的生活对人物的异化。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	钟摆总是沿着相同的轨迹摆动，周而复始，看似很有规律，但却象征着一成不变，平淡无奇的生活状态，困守其中的人精神麻木，生活单调，宛如钟摆。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	林佳如：全职家庭主妇，在婚姻、家庭生活中日复一日地重复单调乏味的主妇生活，渐渐的失去自我。	[]
5 IDX G9 CHI H AND SUYANG.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	李文启：自私，忽视妻子的感受，喜新厌旧。	[]

2 G9 CHI H ANSWERS.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	文学概念整理：	[]
2 G9 CHI H ANSWERS.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	身份认同：某个人或群体试图追寻、确证自己在文化上的“身份”。身份指某个个人或群体据以确认自己在一个社会里之地位的某些明确的、具有显著特征的依据或尺度，如性别、阶级、种族等等 。	['身份']
2 G9 CHI H ANSWERS.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	例子：“误落成网中，一去三十年” 描写陶渊明厌恶官场，将自己视为一个普通百姓而该归隐田园	[]
2 G9 CHI H ANSWERS.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	意象：客观物象经过创作主体独特情感活动而创造出的一种艺术形象，也是用来寄托主观情思的客观物象。	[]
2 G9 CHI H ANSWERS.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	例子：“方宅”，“草屋“表达了田园的自然，清新	['方宅', '草屋']
2 G9 CHI H ANSWERS.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	化虚为实：把抽象的哲理思想，人物情感通过具体物象，外在的符号传递给读者，使读者从实悟虚，便于理解和接受。	[]
2 G9 CHI H ANSWERS.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	例子：“羁鸟”，“池鱼”表达作者摒弃世俗，厌恶官场束缚的思想情感。	['羁鸟', '池鱼']
2 G9 CHI H ANSWERS.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	借喻：比喻的一种。是以喻体来代替本体，本体和喻词都不出现。	[]
2 G9 CHI H ANSWERS.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	例子：“羁鸟恋旧林，池鱼思故渊” （喻体羁鸟，池鱼，本体作者自己，表达作者对田园的向往及将官场视为束缚）	[]
2 G9 CHI H ANSWERS.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	对偶：字数相等，结构相同的句式。	[]
2 G9 CHI H ANSWERS.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	例子：“羁鸟恋旧林，池鱼思故渊”	[]
2 G9 CHI H ANSWERS.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	白描：用最简练的笔墨，不加烘托，描画出鲜明生动的形象。文字简练朴素，不加渲染。	[]
2 G9 CHI H ANSWERS.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	例子：“带月荷锄归”	['带月荷锄归']

1 G9 CHEM N.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	(The term "chemistry" is derived from "alchemy”)	['term', 'chemistry', 'derived', 'alchemy']
1 G9 CHEM N.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Chemistry is defined as the study of the composition of matter and the changes it undergoes. 	['Chemistry', 'defined', 'study', 'composition', 'matter', 'changes', 'undergoes']
1 G9 CHEM N.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Matter: anything that has mass and occupies space. 	['Matter', 'anything', 'mass', 'occupies', 'space']
1 G9 CHEM N.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Composition: the chemical identity of a substance. 	['Composition', 'chemical', 'identity', 'substance']
1 G9 CHEM N.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Changes in matter: physical or chemical changes.	['Changes', 'matter', 'physical', 'chemical', 'changes']

1 G9 CHEM N.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Theory vs. Scientific Laws	['Theory', 'Scientific', 'Laws']
1 G9 CHEM N.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Theories can predict outcomes and are open to revision, while scientific laws summarize observed phenomena.	['Theories', 'predict', 'outcomes', 'open', 'revision', 'scientific', 'laws', 'summarize', 'observed', 'phenomena']
1 G9 CHEM N.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	In other words, theories explain why something happens, and scientific laws state that the thing happens. The latter is a fact, but theories can be changed or improved. For example:	['words', 'theories', 'explain', 'something', 'happens', 'scientific', 'laws', 'state', 'thing', 'happens', 'latter', 'fact', 'theories', 'changed', 'improved', 'example']
1 G9 CHEM N.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Theory: Apple fall from the tree due to the gravitational pull exerted from Earth.	['Theory', 'Apple', 'fall', 'tree', 'due', 'gravitational', 'pull', 'exerted', 'Earth']
1 G9 CHEM N.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Scientific Law: When released from a height objects would fall to the ground.	['Scientific', 'Law', 'released', 'height', 'objects', 'would', 'fall', 'ground']

1 G9 CHEM N.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Tip: During lab, scale readings should be expressed in the form of ± (unit of the last significant figure/2).	['Tip', 'lab', 'scale', 'readings', 'expressed', 'form', 'unit', 'last', 'significant']
1 G9 CHEM N.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	e.g. A reading of 1.14cm should be expressed as (1.14 ± 0.005)cm, as 0.04 is the last significant figure, and its unit is in 0.01, therefore half of it should be 0.005. 	['reading', 'expressed', 'cm', 'last', 'significant', 'figure', 'unit', 'therefore', 'half']

1 G9 CHEM N.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	A physical change may change state of matter, but not composition. 	['physical', 'change', 'may', 'change', 'state', 'matter', 'composition']

1 G9 CHEM N.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	e.g. NH4 (aq) + NO2 (aq)  N2(g) + 2 H2O(l)	['aq', 'aq', 'g', 'l']

5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	6.3 Periodic Trends	['Periodic', 'Trends']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Many properties of the elements change in a predictable way as you move through the period table, and these systematic variations are called periodic trends	['Many', 'properties', 'elements', 'change', 'predictable', 'way', 'move', 'period', 'table', 'systematic', 'variations', 'called', 'periodic', 'trends']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	I. Trends in Atomic Size	['Trends', 'Atomic', 'Size']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	The atomic radius is one-half of the distance between the nuclei of two atoms of the same element when the atoms are joined	['atomic', 'radius', 'distance', 'nuclei', 'two', 'atoms', 'element', 'atoms', 'joined']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	The atomic radius is often measured in picometers (pm).	['atomic', 'radius', 'often', 'measured', 'picometers', 'pm']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	The attraction force between electrons and nucleus will affect many atom’s properties	['attraction', 'force', 'electrons', 'nucleus', 'affect', 'many', 'atom', 'properties']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Trend 1: Atoms get larger going down a group.	['Trend', 'Atoms', 'get', 'larger', 'going', 'group']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Going down a group = more energy levels, attraction decrease = outmost electrons go further, size increase	['Going', 'group', 'energy', 'levels', 'attraction', 'decrease', 'outmost', 'electrons', 'go', 'size', 'increase']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Trend 2: Atoms get smaller moving from left to right across each period.	['Trend', 'Atoms', 'get', 'smaller', 'moving', 'left', 'right', 'across', 'period']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Moving from left to right = same energy level, more protons, attraction increase = outmost electrons closer, atom size decrease	['Moving', 'left', 'right', 'energy', 'level', 'protons', 'attraction', 'increase', 'outmost', 'electrons', 'closer', 'atom', 'size', 'decrease']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	II. Trend for Ionic Size	['II', 'Trend', 'Ionic', 'Size']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	An ion is an atom or group of atoms that has a positive or negative charge 	['ion', 'atom', 'group', 'atoms', 'positive', 'negative', 'charge']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	An ion with a positive charge is called a cation (metal easy to lose electrons)	['ion', 'positive', 'charge', 'called', 'cation', 'metal', 'easy', 'lose', 'electrons']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	An ion with a negative charge is called an anion (nonmetal easy to gain electron)	['ion', 'negative', 'charge', 'called', 'anion', 'nonmetal', 'easy', 'gain', 'electron']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Octet rule: Atoms tend to gain, lose, or share electrons in order to acquire a full set of valence electrons	['Octet', 'rule', 'Atoms', 'tend', 'gain', 'lose', 'share', 'electrons', 'order', 'acquire', 'full', 'set', 'valence', 'electrons']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	For most energy levels, there are 8 valence electrons in a full set of valence electrons --- 2 in s orbital and 6 in p orbitals	['energy', 'levels', 'valence', 'electrons', 'full', 'set', 'valence', 'electrons', 'orbital', 'p', 'orbitals']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	An exception for the first energy level, which is full with only 2 electrons	['exception', 'first', 'energy', 'level', 'full', 'electrons']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	The elements on the right side of the periodic table tend to gain electrons – or become anions – in order to acquire a complete set of valence electrons (being stable)	['elements', 'right', 'side', 'periodic', 'table', 'tend', 'gain', 'electrons', 'become', 'anions', 'order', 'acquire', 'complete', 'set', 'valence', 'electrons', 'stable']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	The elements on the left side of the periodic table tend to lose electrons – or become cations – in order to acquire a complete set of valence electrons (being stable)	['elements', 'left', 'side', 'periodic', 'table', 'tend', 'lose', 'electrons', 'become', 'cations', 'order', 'acquire', 'complete', 'set', 'valence', 'electrons', 'stable']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Noble gases neither gain nor lose electrons	['Noble', 'gases', 'neither', 'gain', 'lose', 'electrons']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Positive Ions (lose electrons) become smaller, because the repulsion between electrons is reduced, radius of a cation is smaller than an atom	['Positive', 'Ions', 'lose', 'electrons', 'become', 'smaller', 'repulsion', 'electrons', 'reduced', 'radius', 'cation', 'smaller', 'atom']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Negative Ions (gain electrons) become larger, because the repulsion between electrons is increased, radius of an anion is larger than an atom	['Negative', 'Ions', 'gain', 'electrons', 'become', 'larger', 'repulsion', 'electrons', 'increased', 'radius', 'anion', 'larger', 'atom']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Trend 1: Ions get larger going down a group	['Trend', 'Ions', 'get', 'larger', 'going', 'group']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Trend 2: Ions get smaller from left to right	['Trend', 'Ions', 'get', 'smaller', 'left', 'right']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	The anions in same period and cation of next period have same number of electrons but proton number is increasing in nucleus, thus the attraction force increases and ion sized decreases	['anions', 'period', 'cation', 'next', 'period', 'number', 'electrons', 'proton', 'number', 'increasing', 'nucleus', 'thus', 'attraction', 'force', 'increases', 'ion', 'sized', 'decreases']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Trend 3: For same elements, the one with less electrons (more positive or less negative) is smaller	['Trend', 'elements', 'one', 'less', 'electrons', 'positive', 'less', 'negative', 'smaller']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	III. Trend for Ionization Energy	['III', 'Trend', 'Ionization', 'Energy']

5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	Ionization energy trends are exactly opposite of the trends for atomic radius, and radius is inversely proportional to attraction while ionization energy is proportional to attraction	['Ionization', 'energy', 'trends', 'exactly', 'opposite', 'trends', 'atomic', 'radius', 'radius', 'inversely', 'proportional', 'attraction', 'ionization', 'energy', 'proportional', 'attraction']
5 IDX G9 CHEM S ALT.docx	2025-04-04 19:31:38	  	[]
